Reviews.Title: “Small but nice!”
Reviews.Author: thegigibun
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located but not on a major street...so it's quiet. The rooms are small but adequate. I had a superior room w/balcony and it was nice...must tell you that I had the room by myself so space was not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and not much more.”
Reviews.Author: frank m
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located and the manager is cordial. Nothing else is commendable. The lobby is a closet like room which is not always staffed. Our room was clean but very small. The view unlike the pictures on the web site, was of scaffolding on the adjacent building almost within arms length. The breakfast room is small and food offering very limited. The T.V. did not work. We were not in Rome to watch T.V., but it should have functioned. We stayed at hotels and agriturismos from Milan to Venice to Florence to Rome and in between. Rome is teriffic. This Hotel was the only disappointment and not worth 180 euros per night, even at Rome prices.

Reviews.Title: “one night transit”
Reviews.Author: MamdouhSA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location being only 250 metres from the Spanish Steps and Spagna metro station. room is ok (we booked triple room, even we were 2) breakfast is not good even it was in room price. no reception after 11pm. good restaurant adviced by the staff was very good and not turist one (i think it s name is ramba or rampa, near AMEX)

Reviews.Title: “Great location !”
Reviews.Author: KATDEN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Il Piccolo for 5 nights and, eventhough the triple is tiny, the balcony, the elevator, and the cleanliness of the room makes up for it. Great location to Trevi and Spanish Steps. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: PacoParis
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the negative reviews: the rooms are ugly and small (even for us Parisians, used to small spaces!) and grungy and the service ranges indifferent to hostile. There was no iron available, unacceptable for a 3-star hotel in a major European city. The housekeeping cart is permanently parked in the hallway: this sounds like a petty complaint until you return from a day from elegant Rome and are struck by the site of cleaning products: this truly lacks class! We asked for a "simple" restaurant and were directed to an awful, over-priced tourist trap. We asked whether we'd parked our car legally and the receptionist didn't know. The return at night is truly unwelcoming: you must buzz from downstairs, wait several minutes, and then go up to the fourth floor (the cubicle that serves as reception is closed at night.) We didn’t know this until other guests who happened to be waiting, too, told us: no one at reception had. These same guests, enthusiastic Californians obvious trying to remain optimistic, described the hotel as “interesting”: this is not a compliment!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: kowloonfan
Reviews.Content: I was greeted by name and shown to my room by Patrizia a very friendly lady who also gave me a map and gave me information on the local area. The hotel is a bit hard to find about half way along Via Due Macelli just after the junction with Via Cappola Di Case above a shoe shop with just a brass plaque outside. If you are coming from the Spanish Steps it is on the right. There is a very small antiquated lift to take you up to the 4th floor where the rooms are but it works fine so not a problem. My room was Borromini, small but comfortable and had everything I needed and was very quiet. The view was over roof tops and the church/bell tower behind the hotel. The bell rings at 7am each morning so no need for an alarm clock! The shower in the bathroom was very small and I struggled with the doors on occasions but the water was plentiful and hot. The breakfast is not good,a choice of only one croissant or bread roll or yogurt and one drink so use one of the numerous cafes nearby if you need food in the morning. The hotel is in a great location being only 250 metres from the Spanish Steps and Spagna metro station and if you walk 250 metres in the other direction down to Via del Tritone and cross the road there is a bus stop used by various open bus tour companies. I took one of these on my first day to get my bearings and see the main sights and found it very useful. The Trevi Fountain is also a short walk away and well worth a visit. Do climb the Spanish Steps and visit Pincio for amazing views over the city and take a breather in the lovely shady park. I really enjoyed my stay at Piccolo the staff were friendly and helpful, my room was clean and comfortable and I felt safe in the area which is important if you travel on your own as I do. If you want something other that chain hotel sameness with a bit of character at a reasonable price you could do much worse in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A great location; a nice,small hotel”
Reviews.Author: larrchar
Reviews.Content: We returned on 04/13 from a 3-day stay at the Piccolo. The staff was very nice, especially Patrizia, the day manager. They opened their breakfast room early so we could have coffee and a quick breakfast as we were leaving early on Wed. Patrizia made a deal for the cab and then walked us out to the curb when the cab arrived; at 7 a.m. The rooms are small, but clean. The bathroom is also small and there is only a hand-held shower hose in the tub. It is not possible to get a cup of tea or anything else there after the breakfast hour. The location, between the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain is great. This hotel does not have a lobby.

Reviews.Title: “The worst customer service I have ever experienced!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahope
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Rome and the first man who was working in the hotel was very accomodating since I didnt have my reservation number as my friend was coming to Rome a bit later that day and he had all the details. He then showed me the room and told me it was a single but if I was happy with the size we could stay there as it did have a double bed. Although the room was tiny and the bathroom very small we were happy enough to stay in it. Anyway, The second night we came home after dinner around midnight and were met by the night staff who was rude, arrogant and aggressive when he attacked us saying that he didnt have my document on file and that I would not be able to stay there that night without paying a suppliment for the room. The document and suppliment were not an issue, it was his aggressive attitude towards his guests!! He even said "for all I know you could be a P".....(then paused thought about it and said "a bad person". He aggresively told us that we had taken total advantage of staying in a single room. I told him his colleague had obviously made the mistake by not asking me for the extra or my passport and that it certainly was not our fault. He was grinding his teath with the anger. We demanded to speak to the hotel manager, so he called someone and spoke to him and never handed me the phone saying the Manager refused to speak to me. This is customer service?? After a big discussion I gave him my Irish Passport and the extra money and the next day I spoke to the first guy, who laughed it off and said that it was just this guys CHARACTER!! And we got no apology whatsoever for how we had been treated. This hotel is located on Piazza di Spagna and you would think that the staff would be trained in hospitality even if it is a three star hotel. The guy who works night shift was a nasty, angry and ignorant man who should not be working in this industry and he ruined our stay in Rome. I would NOT recommend staying at that hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A breath of real Roman life...!”
Reviews.Author: Eurasian_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in this hotel and I found it "perfect" for my needs....a small, sweet, clean and very good located hotel in Rome. If you don't want a 5 star, overcrowded, international hotel this is the perfect choice! The location is amazing (3 minutes walk from Spagna metro station), the staff was very kind, it looked like to stay in a friend's house, not in an hotel! If you are a "real traveler" that want to taste "the atmospheres" of the towns you visit, this is your choice. If you need crowded swimmingpools, ballrooms, restaurants and so on....forget it!! I already reccomend it to my friends! Manuel (Thailand)

Reviews.Title: “A disaster! The worst experience possible.”
Reviews.Author: fuzz999
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel for one night because of the reviews on trip advisor and the photos on the hotel's internet site, So, We learnt a lesson. Never to get carried away by reviews and never to believe what you see on websites. It was our upteenth time to Rome but this hotel ranked as one of the worst I have ever been to in my life (supposedly 3 star). The room was miniscule and run down. I therefore immediately went downstairs to complain we were given another room which was slightly better but still terrible. My wife and I therefore decided to leave. The person at the desk told us we were free to go (I started to believe I was in prison) but had to pay!! We argued and finally left. Do yourselves a favour stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch Trap”
Reviews.Author: texas49
Reviews.Content: Our experience with this place tainted what was otherwise a great trip around Italy. We booked the hotel on the hotel web site, and selected the hotel because of the amenities listed on that web site. On the train in to Rome from Naples, we made a call in for directions, only to be told they had unilaterally moved us to another hotel a quarter of a mile away (the Spagna Inn). Our protests fell on deaf ears. Given the lateness in the day and our inability to find other lodgings on such short notice, we had no choice but to take the other room. The room and other facilities at Spagna Inn were not at all acceptable, and not on a level with what we had agreed to. To begin, the facilities at the Spagna Inn lacked nearly all the amenities represented to be available at the Piccolo. Unlike the Piccolo, the Spagna Inn has no elevator, TV room, game room, garden/terrace, jacuzzi, or room service, as advertised on the Piccolo's web site. On our arrival at the Spagna Inn, the individual at the front desk refused to assist carrying our luggage to our fourth floor room up the hotel's small, winding staircase. Essentially, my female traveling companion and I were told that we were on our own getting our luggage (consisting of three large suitcases) to our room. When we arrived in our room, we found the room's safe did not work, and when we informed the front desk of that fact, he informed us that his colleague would try to come by "around 8:00 p.m." to look at it. It took multiple calls to the Piccolo before someone came to open the safe. As a result, we were delayed for nearly an hour in beginning any sightseeing during our one afternoon in Rome. Later, when we got ready to leave for dinner and asked the front desk to call us a cab, we were informed that "there are no taxis in this region." This is unbelievable, given the fact that the hotel is less than three blocks from the Spanish Steps. As a final insult, we discovered the morning of our departure for the Rome airport that the Piccolo's promised "shuttle to airport" would cost us $45 - exactly the price of a taxi cab ride. Again, the Piccolo and Spagna Inn failed to provide the services promised, or at the very least deliberately misled us as to the services provided. Bottom line - don't trust these guys at Piccolo.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Avid-Traveler-Fun
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a very central location and easy to see all the sights in Rome. One issue - walls are very thin and we could hear people coming into the hotel in the early hours of the morning after a long night of drinking. The hotel staff was friendly and spoke english. Would recommend this hotel to those looking for a centrally-located hotel and are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, but nothing terrible”
Reviews.Author: Leslie1121
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very clean. Breakfast area was very crowded, and there weren't many people staying at hotel. Breakfast items were very basic compared to other locations we visited during our Italy trip. At night, when you visit the in-suite bathroom, I found it very impractical, as there was no night-light, and you had to turn on the light outside the bathroom, then step up a large step, to get in to the bathroom. A night light would have been very helpful. Our party had 2 rooms, and this was a challenge with both rooms. Also, there were no English speaking stations on the TV. When you're in your room, TV can be a nice way to wind down. The location was not easy to find, but that may be Rome. We were there 4 days, and never found it easy to navigate back to our hotel. The staff was pleasant, but I don't think this was an exceptional property and would look to find an alternate place to stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading glowing reviews on Tripadvisor we booked and stayed for 4 nights in October at Il Piccolo di piazza di Spagna in Rome and were very disappointed. The first night was spent in a tiny room with a pokey bathroom, hard bed and very noisy. Next morning we were moved to another, larger room with a balcony only to find after settling in that it only had a hand held shower over a bath, without any screen - very difficult to shower without flooding the room. Decided not to ask for another move and spent 3 very uncomfortable nights in another rock hard bed. No street noise but voices and plumbing noises very clear through the walls from adjoining rooms. Very inadequate breakfast served in an alcove which seated maximum of 6 people at a time. The staff were helpful when asked. The location was good but after walking many kilometres sightseeing, the most important thing is a good shower and comfortable bed and this hotel just didn't measure up - did not deserve 3 star rating and I would not recommend it or stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Roman Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nostril
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent eight nights in this hotel at the end of August/beginning of September. I wasn't expecting perfection, in fact if anything a few flaws, given the relative cheap price for our stay. However I have to say that I can't imagine a friendlier, cleaner, charming and romantic little Roman hotel. On arriving the receptionist, Davide, took our bags up the quaint caged elevator to our room. Our room, 'Giotto', had a corner balcony overlooking the monestary next door. The room was small but comfortable, the decor charming and authentic. The room was spotless and was kept so throughout our stay by the maid who cleaned it every morning. We found the staff friendly and helpful and always ready to give us advice or assistance with local information. As for the location - a two minute walk to the Spanish Steps, less than five to the Trevi Fountain. We fully intend to return to Rome and will definetly be booking our stay at the Hotel Piccolo. We were on our honeymoon and after a couple of days my new wife told me that she thought the room was "perfect". I couldn't have asked for more, really.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Benoit
Reviews.Content: I arrived to the hotel on the evening of Saturday, September 4, 2005, and their was no room available despite the reservation had been confirmed and paid in advance 40 days before. The hotel receptionist offered to move us to a hotel 20 metres down the road, which I found to be a Bed & Breakfast of far inferior quality. I asked for at least a same category of hotel in the area and they sent us to the Hotel Forte, where after checking in they gave us the key for an appartment five blocks away, where we had to go walking carrying the lugagge ourselves, through Rome at night after a whole day of travel. When we got there the building had no elevator and the appt. was in the third floor. Nobody was there to help with the lugagge. I called the hotel clerk and demanded a refund or a strong discount and he offered me to pay only 50 euros back from HIS OWN POCKET, so that the issue was hidden under the carpet, of course. I refused to accept this, and looked for another hotel nearby. This was a complete lack of respect and I'm going to request a total refund, otherwise I will initiate legal actions.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly staff and excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on comments about to Il Piccolo on Trip Advisor. My Girlfirend and I stayed for two weeks and we were certainly not dissapointed. In the two weeks, we could not find one single complaint. The Rooms were spotless, The breakfast was good, The location was absolutely excellent - only 2 minutes walk from the Spanish Steps and finally the staff are extremely friendly and go out of their way to help guests. Example; One day during our stay, I asked a male staff member at reception about how I would get to Sperlonga on a day trip. He offered to research the internet on my behalf to find out but I told him not to bother as I did not want to put him to such trouble. He rang my half an hour later and told me exactly how to get there. He had gone to the trouble to surfing the net to find out the necessary information on my behalf. I was most impressed with this level of customer service and my girlfriend and I headed off and enjoyed a great day in Spearlonga. Anyway I could not reccomend this hotel any more. 5 out of 5. G Hurley

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_Review_Queen
Reviews.Content: Great hotel,location exellent 5 minutes to Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain.We stayed in the Michelangelo room which has it's own terrace.It was nice to sit out on and have breakfast,and lovely on an evening with a bottle of vino.The room was basic,but very clean.The staff were friendly and helpful.The only fault was the jacuzzi in the bathroom did not work.We did report this but nothing was done.Would definately reccomend this hotel.We had a fantastic time in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Dodgyknee
Reviews.Content: We have just had four nights at this hotel as we went to celebrate a friend's 40th birthday in Rome. From the moment we checked in on Thursday lunchtime to when we checked out on Monday morning this hotel does exactly what it says on the tin. The staff were friendly and efficient and the girl (can't remember her name - Noreena or something) who served the breakfast and was doing the cleaning each morning deserves special mention. We were offered two rooms for the four of us on arrival, one with balcony (Bernini) and one without (Ghirlandaio). We let the birthday girl and her husband have the balcony but each morning all four of us would eat on their balcony. Breakfast consisted of a choice of cereal (cornflakes and coco pops while we were there), rolls, croissants and pastries, fruit juice, tea and coffee and is a case of help yourself. The rooms themselves whilst on the small side are perfectly functional but most importantly spotlessly clean. The air conditioning worked a treat at night and was a godsend as the temperature outside was in the 40's. Not sure how effective it would be in the day but who wants to be in a hotel room during the day in Rome? The biggest selling point for this hotel has to be its location. We walked everywhere, 5 minutes to Spanish Steps, 5 minutes to Trevi Fountain, 10 minutes to Pantheon, 25 minutes to Piazza Navona and 30-35 minutes to either the Vatican or Roman Forum and Colosseum. Would I stay in this hotel again? Without a shadow of doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Il Piccolo - small is beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: SJE1UK
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel. Just returned from a fascinating weekend exploring Rome and what a great base to stay. If you are lucky enough to get a balcony then you cannot go wrong for chilling out with a beer or wine after a tough day touring this incredible city. The staff are friendly and helpful and when we return to Rome will have no hesitation in trying to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem”
Reviews.Author: RhiannonB
Reviews.Content: This was a great little hotel and really lived up to the reviews. We were lucky enough to have the Giotto room. The rooms are a fair size by European standards, and having the balcony to relax at night was fantastic. The Giotto room is away from the noise of the streets, next to the courtyard of the monastery so very quiet and peaceful. We sat out there most evenings with a bottle of wine - there is a Spar nearby to purchase nibbles and wine. Breakfast was very good - very fresh pastries, many types of coffee, orange juice, yoghurts, bread and cheese The location is excellent, a minute away from the Spanish Steps, in the heart of Rome. Most of the major attractions are within walking distance, or taxis are very cheap too. Our most expensive taxi fare, other than the airport, was E6. This isn't the Ritz - it's not luxurious or trimmed with velvet and gold, just a cosy hotel with a very Roman feel. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough - a real jewel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: goodtrip77
Reviews.Content: This was a great place! The hotel is up on the 4th floor but there is a (very cute) lift. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It's in a great location near the Spanish Steps and the subway and we walked everywhere, including the Vatican and the Colliseum. It was an easy walk to the subway with our luggage to get to the train station/airport. We had the Bernini room, which was very nice with tasteful decor. It was a decent size and we had a balcony. It had air conditioning (thank goodness, since we were there during a heat wave!!) and a mini bar. Everything was clean and the bathroom had new fixtures and tiles, but the shower stall was a little small (don't drop anything because you'll have trouble bending over in there!) The continental breakfast was good -- juice, yogurt, nice selection of fresh pastries and rolls, cereal, and coffee. The capuccino was excellent! Overall this was a great place and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Xanu
Reviews.Content: We just got back and stayed here 5 nights. What charm!! We couldn't get the Michaelangelo or the Giotto rooms so we were concerned what type of room they'd put us in, but ended up in the Bernini. We were very pleased. Our room was long and narrow, with wooden floors and a lovely balcony. Most importantly, the room and bathroom were spotless! We met another american couple who also didn't get the 2 famous rooms, but were very happy with their room and they also had a balcony. The staff could not be any nicer. Paola, who seems to be the manager, is a total gem. She always smiles and wants to make you happy. Davide, Donatello and Daniele are also always willing to help and make suggestions. They just can't do enough for you. Even the housekeeper, Adriana, is as nice as can be. It's true that you hear breakfast being prepared in the morning, but who cares, you're not there to sleep in late!! The location is unbelievable. I am not exaggerating when I say that the Spanish Steps is a 3-5 minute walk, the Trevi maybe 5 minutes, Piazza Navona 12 min, the Pantheon 12 min, Via veneto 15 minutes and the Bernini Square 10 minutes. We took the Metro (5 minutes away) to the Vatican (only because we were running late) and walked back, which took 30-40 minutes, it was great. I would definitely stay at Il Piccolo again. It was full of charm, with a great staff, a (clean) room with a balcony, and a fantastic and safe location - who can ask for more?

Reviews.Title: “A Special Place in a Special City!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This unique and charming Hotel is perfect for those that want to be close to the charm of the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. It is an unusual place located on the fourth floor of an old building. The staff was incredibly gracious, professional and accommodating. The rooms aren't large but why would you want to linger in your room when there is so much to explore right outside your door? We had a lovely terrace (we were staying in the room "Giotto" that overlooked an old church.) Paola and her staff make you feel right at home. I'd defintely go back and stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I have just returned from 4 nights in Rome (end April 2005) -We stayed at Il Piccolo di Piazza di Spagna after many hours spent (by me) trawling the internet and guide books reading reviews of hotels and their locations. One of the best reviews I found was for Piccolo di Piazza di Spagna. Having read a previous visitors review on TripAdvisor I made my reservation and asked for the same room as they'd recommended (Michelangelo). When we arrived the lady was very nice and said there was a problem with Michelangelo but had put us in the room immediately next door, which had exactly the same facilities (apparently). We stayed in Giotto and we found the room, the hotel and the staff excellent. It turned out they had made a double booking and that was what the "problem" was. I had no problem with this as the room was faultless and had a balacony, large bathroom, wadrobe space with a safe, bedside table, etc. Lets face it, when you're in Rome you don't really want (or need) to go back to the hotel in the daytime do you?! There are so many other things to do and see. With regard to the previous person's dissatisfaction - you need to do your research and read what other people have said and book the right room! The breakfast was just fine and we chose to have this in our room. You can then do what you like and take it out to the balcony if you wish, which is very pleasant (if you have one of course!), or have it in bed. The only downpoint about the hotel I would say is that the walls are paper thin and you can hear conversations and TVs through them! you can also hear people in the corridors and the breakfast being prepared. This, I think, you will not escape in most hotels, and unless you have bags of money to spend in a 5* luxury hotel, I think this is a minor point to have to put up with in this hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anybody and if we ever went back to Rome, I would certainly stay here again. It's in a great location, the staff are fab, the lift is an experience, it is spotlessley clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny and cramped”
Reviews.Author: docus48
Reviews.Content: This is in an excellent location, just yards from the Spanish Steps. Our room was spotlessly clean. However we had the world's smallest room. Two very narrow single beds. Barely room between the bottom of the bed and the dressing table. No chair or bedside table. Bathroom was minute, no bath just a tiny shower. Very cramped. No public areas at all, just a tiny alcove with 3 small tables where you took breakfast. Just as well that we didn't want to eat at the same time as everyone else. All the time we were there, 4 days, we saw just 3 members of staff, all of them very pleasant and helpful. But it was an odd sort of place. Fine just for sleeping in, but certainly not the sort of place you can come back to and relax in the middle of the day.

Reviews.Title: “great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: ricthevicScarborough
Reviews.Content: The hotel was everything the other reviews have said. A great location, all the main Rome sites are within walking distance. Hotel floor plan is small, but everything spotlessly clean. Staff very helpful. The small terrace (we had room Michealangelo) will be ideal in the summer, but too cold for breakfast in February! The lift (elevator) is worth coming to use on its own!! Must be pre war. Can recommend this hotel for a budget, no frills holiday.

Reviews.Title: “A solid choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: lawoffice
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 9-20-04 to 9-24-04, and it was a great pick. The hotel is small, on the 4th floor of an office building, but that shouldn't stop you. The rooms have names, we stayed in the Michaelangelo, and from what I could see, there are at least 3 rooms with small terraces. We had one. The breakfast room was just outside and we took a tray with breakfast onto the terrace each morning, a treat. We selected this hotel for location; we walked to the Spanish Steps, very close by, and the Forum, Colliseum, Trevi fountain, and the Pantheon. The staff got us a nice Vatican tour on short notice. They were very accomodating. They discounted the room by ten Euro per night for a cash payment. The amenities included a room safe, dryer, marble bathroom. Average room size, plus the terrace, and what must be the oldest elevator in Europe. A good choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Choach73
Reviews.Content: After arriving from Florence a little early we dropped off our car rental (you don't need a car in Rome!!) and made our way to the hotel. The receptionist called up to see if our room was ready and thankfully it was. We went up there and found a spacious, very clean, air conditioned room. It was fabulous. The bathroom was big, the shower a little on the small side for North American taste's but still big. The hotel itself is located in the heart of it all. We walked to the Trevi fountain, the Spanish Steps and the metro to take a 10 minute train ride to the Vatican City or go the other way to the Coloseum. This hotel is literally in the heart of it all. You have to walk in to the hotel entrance, there's a little desk on the left to check in and then you have to take a lift to your room. It's no big deal. I did week's of research on the internet and I was very pleased with this hotel. Stay here, you won't regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location/hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent-one block from the Spanish Steps. The rooms were clean, neat, and had soundproofed windows. The staff spoke English and were very friendly and helpful. The included continental breakfast was ample. Our room had a small balcony overlooking the street, although not all rooms do.

HotelInfo.Name: Il Piccolo di Piazza di Spagna
HotelInfo.Address: Via dei due Macelli, 47, 187 Rome, Italy
